body.p: The homeostatic control of blood (plasma) calcium levels requires interactions between several body systems. Calcium is ingested through the diet, absorbed by the digestive system, moves into the cardiovascular system, and some is processed through the urinary system.Calcium is ingested through the diet, absorbed by the digestive system, moves into the cardiovascular system, and some is processed through the urinary system. The endocrine system regulates calcium exchange between cells, extracellular fluid and the bones, as discussed in the previous Module.
